citation.article-title: Pyrodictium, a new genus of submarine disc-shaped sulfur reducing archaebacteria growing optimally at 105C.

p.s: Description of Pyrodictium occultum sp. nov.
Pyrodictium occultum (oc. cul'tum. L. occultum, L. neutr. adj. hidden, indicating the invisibility of the network in the phase contrast microscope)
The DNA base composition is about 62 mol% G+C.
The cell envelope contains a major periodate-Sciff-positive protein with a molecular weight of 172,000.
Growth yield is not significantly stimulated by 0.2% yeast extract.
Serological cross-reaction of all strains with antibodies against whole cells of strain PL-19.
Type strain is DSM 2709, Göttingen, FRG.
